channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: China expresses 'deep shock' over attack on its nationals in Karachi, 'demands' Pak to close security loopholes
item.description: China expresses deep shock over the killing of two Chinese nationals in a suicide attack in Karachi and demands Pakistan to enhance security for Chinese workers involved in CPEC projects. The attack, claimed by the Baloch Liberation Army, highlights ongoing concerns about the safety of Chinese personnel in Pakistan.

item.title: Vivek Ramaswamy finally finds his reply to Ann Coulter: 'I never thought I'd vote for somebody non-Christian'
item.description: When Ann Coulter made the comment, Vivek praised her for speaking her mind and said he respected her. "Ann Coulter told me flat-out to my face that she couldn't vote for me 'because you're an India', even though she agreed with me more than most other candidates. I disagree with her but respect she had the guts to speak her mind," Ramaswamy said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: King Charles has started eating lunch for the first time. And it's half an avocado
item.description: King Charles now includes half an avocado in his lunch after being advised by doctors and Queen Camilla, especially since his cancer diagnosis. Previously, he used to skip lunch due to his busy schedule. He and Queen Camilla will soon embark on a royal tour of Australia suspending his cancer treatment for 11 days which has been permitted by his doctors.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Trump allowed Melania to watch top-secret Special Forces operation: 'Did she have security clearance?'
item.description: ​Melania got to know the identity of a soldier -- Colan, a black-faced Belgian Malinois US military dog who was injured in the US raid in Syria that killed ISIS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. The Daily Beast noted that Melania did not have a security clearance to enter the most secure room in the White House but cited Tim Naftali to state that a first lady may access government secrets at the discretion of the president.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris called 'disgusting' for 'Call Her Daddy' podcast; Alex Cooper says Trump is also welcome
item.description: Kamala Harris appeared on the 'Call Her Daddy' podcast amid criticism from Trump’s campaign, which accused her of self-interest during a crisis. Her discussion on abortion rights aimed to reach a broader, non-political audience. Host Alex Cooper expressed her intention to contribute to election discussions centered on women's issues, inviting Trump for similar dialogue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Explosion near Israeli embassy in Denmark
item.description: An explosion near the Israeli embassy in Denmark coincided with the anniversary of the Hamas attack on Israel. Copenhagen police are investigating a potential link to previous explosions, but believe the incident may have been caused by gunfire. Swedish nationals were previously detained in connection with earlier blasts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Israel releases unseen footage from October 7 Hamas onslaught
item.description: On October 7, Israel faced one of its deadliest days as Hamas militants unleashed a massive attack, leading to over 1,200 Israeli deaths and more than 250 hostages. Israel's retaliation against Gaza resulted in over 41,000 civilian casualties, escalating into a broader conflict involving Hezbollah.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris dodges question on Netanyahu being US's 'close ally'
item.description: US Vice President Kamala Harris avoided a direct answer on whether Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu remains a 'close ally,' emphasizing the alliance between the American and Israeli people. She highlighted US efforts in pushing for a ceasefire amid Israel's ongoing attacks on Gaza and Lebanon. The US supports Israel's right to self-defense while urging minimization of civilian harm.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Over 6,000 people in Haiti leave their homes after gang attack killed dozens
item.description: Nearly 6,300 people fled after gang violence in central Haiti killed at least 70. Displaced families mostly stay with relatives, while others shelter in various sites. The attack in Pont-Sonde involved shootings and arson. Authorities, including the UN and EU, condemned the violence. Prime Minister Garry Conille vowed justice for the victims.

item.title: 'Wouldn't have given birth': Gaza mother struggles to provide for newborns amid conflict
item.description: Following the deadly Hamas-led attack on Israel on October 7, 2023, Israel's counteroffensive has led to severe conditions for 2.3 million displaced Gazans. Compounded by widespread disease and limited access to essential resources, the crisis has particularly affected newborns and mothers, escalating humanitarian concerns. "If it were up to me, I wouldn't have gotten pregnant or given birth during the war," she said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Kamala Harris Kicks off media blitz with ‘Call Her Daddy’
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris intensifies efforts for the November election through multiple media appearances targeting key voter groups. Her campaign focuses on abortion rights, student debt relief, and courting the youth and female voters. Meanwhile, Democratic candidate Tim Walz addresses past misspeaking incidents and plans further media engagements in swing states.

item.title: Was Helene 'deliberately' steered towards Republican areas?
item.description: As Hurricane Milton approaches Florida, recovery from Hurricane Helene is hindered by conspiracy theories and misinformation. Claims of FEMA fund misappropriation and weather control have been debunked, yet continue to spread. Authorities strive to counteract these falsehoods to aid affected communities, but rising distrust complicates relief efforts.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Seized vehicles, weapons used by Hamas in October 7 attack on display in Israel
item.description: On the first anniversary of the October 7 attacks by Hamas, the IDF displayed seized items including vehicles, uniforms, and weapons. The exhibit highlighted the extensive military gear captured, amidst ongoing conflict and rising civilian casualties in Gaza, sparking international calls for a ceasefire and a two-state solution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Not 1950s anymore': Kamala Harris responds to 'doesn’t have children keeping her humble' remark
item.description: Vice president Kamala Harris rebutted Arkansas governor Sarah Huckabee Sanders' claims that she lacks humility due to not having biological children. Highlighting the evolving roles of women and family structures, Harris highlighted her 'modern family' and urged women to uplift each other.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US lawmakers arrive in Taiwan for bilateral talks amid China tensions
item.description: US Representatives Debbie Lesko, Andy Biggs, and Carol Miller visit Taiwan for talks with government officials, highlighting US Congress's support for Taiwan and stability in the Taiwan Strait. Discussions focus on US-Taiwan relations, security, and economic policies, with plans to enhance defence cooperation.

item.title: PTI member 'invites' Jaishankar to join protest, party distances itself
item.description: Imran Khan's PTI has clarified it did not invite India's external affairs minister S Jaishankar to join its protests, emphasizing no foreign country can comment on its internal matters. Meanwhile, in Lahore, 30 PTI supporters were arrested as they demanded Khan's release.

item.title: Chinese hackers breached US court wiretap systems: Report
'Ridiculous ploy': Lara Trump slams 165-page brief in father-in-law Donald Trump's election case
item.description: Lara Trump criticizes the timing of a federal prosecutors' brief in Donald Trump's election fraud case, calling it a 'ploy' to sway voters. The 165-page brief highlights accusations that Trump's actions post-2020 election were personal, not official. Trump has pleaded not guilty, maintaining the investigation is politically motivated while expressing his demand for a fair and transparent 2024 election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: The best memes of Elon Musk jumping at Trump's Butler rally
item.description: Elon Musk made headlines by appearing at Donald Trump's rally in Butler, Pennsylvania. Sporting a 'MAGA' cap and 'Occupy Mars' shirt, Musk dubbed himself 'Dark MAGA' and stressed the importance of Trump's victory in the 2024 election. He has established a super PAC to support Trump and shared a video endorsing the former president amidst an assassination attempt.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Massive explosion near Karachi airport leaves several injured
item.description: An explosion near Karachi Airport caused by a suspected tanker blast has injured at least ten people and resulted in one fatality. Authorities are investigating the incident. Rescue teams and medical personnel are providing aid while the area and airport entry points remain closed for safety.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
